com.guardsquare.dexguard.encryption.resource
Class ResourceEncryptionPlugin

java.lang.Object
  com.guardsquare.dexguard.encryption.resource.ResourceEncryptionPlugin

public abstract class ResourceEncryptionPlugin
extends java.lang.Object

Plugin for encrypting and decrypting Android resources.

The following constraints apply to extensions of this class:

  • Implementations must not define non-static inner classes.
  • Implementations must have a no-argument constructor.
  • Instances of implementing classes must not be passed as arguments to methods.
  • Implementations may have a state, but the state may only be changed in the initialize(long) method, and may only depend on the seed parameter of this method.
  • Any field can be declared, but the decryptResource(byte[], int, String) method must only access fields of the following types:
    • all primitive types;
    • arrays of primitives;
    • all List, Set and Map implementations of the Java Collections Framework;
    • String, BigInteger and BigDecimal.

The initialize(long) and encryptResource(byte[], int, String) methods may access fields of any type. DexGuard will automatically remove any methods and fields that are only used during encryption.

The encryption part of this class is executed by DexGuard during obfuscation. The decryption part is integrated in and executed by the application that is processed. This additionally requires that:

  • the following methods must only use API that is available in the runtime environment of DexGuard (i.e., the Java Standard libraries from the JDK):
    • initialize(long)
    • encryptResource(byte[], int, String)
  • the following method must only use API that is available in the runtime environment of the application (e.g., for Android applications, the Android SDK libraries):
    • decryptResource(byte[], int, String)

Constructor Detail

ResourceEncryptionPlugin

public ResourceEncryptionPlugin()
Method Detail

initialize

public void initialize(long seed)
Initializes this encryption plugin for the given seed. The initialization should be deterministic: multiple calls to this method with the same seed must result in exactly the same instance state.

Parameters:
seed - a seed to initialize this encryption plugin.

encryptResource

public abstract byte[] encryptResource(byte[] bytes,
                                       int resourceId,
                                       java.lang.String fileName)
Encrypts the given bytes.

Parameters:
bytes - the data to encrypt.
resourceId - the resource ID corresponding to the encrypted bytes.
fileName - the (possibly obfuscated) filename of the resource to be decrypted.
Returns:
the encrypted bytes.

decryptResource

public abstract byte[] decryptResource(byte[] encryptedBytes,
                                       int resourceId,
                                       java.lang.String fileName)
Decrypts the given encrypted bytes.

Parameters:
encryptedBytes - the bytes to be decrypted.
resourceId - the resource ID corresponding to the encrypted bytes.
fileName - the (possibly obfuscated) filename of the resource to be decrypted.
Returns:
the decrypted bytes.
